birth_place.zh-cn: 清四川省潼川府遂宁县双江镇
birth_place.en: Shuangjiang Town, Suining County, Tongchuan Prefecture, Sichuan Province, Qing Dynasty

death_place.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国北京市中国人民解放军总医院
death_place.en: General Hospital of the People's Liberation Army, Beijing, People's Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党和中华人民共和国的政治人物，原正国级领导人，中国人民解放军高级将领。曾任中华人民共和国主席、中共中央军委副主席等职，是中共八大元老之一。
description.en: A politician of the Communist Party of China and the People's Republic of China, a former national-level leader, and a senior general of the People's Liberation Army. He served as President of the People's Republic of China, Vice Chairman of the CPC Central Military Commission, and was one of the Eight Elders of the CPC.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党第二代中央领导集体的核心人物，被官方称为“中国社会主义改革开放和现代化建设的总设计师”。
description.en: The paramount leader of the People's Republic of China from 1978 until his retirement in 1989. He was the core of the second generation of Chinese leadership.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党第三代中央领导集体的核心人物，曾任中共中央总书记、中华人民共和国主席、中央军委主席。
description.en: The core of the third generation of Chinese leadership, who served as General Secretary of the Chinese Communist Party, President of the People's Republic of China, and Chairman of the Central Military Commission.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党和中华人民共和国主要领导人之一，曾任中华人民共和国主席。
description.en: A major leader of the Communist Party of China and the People's Republic of China, who served as President of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党和中华人民共和国的领导人之一，中共八大元老之一，曾任中华人民共和国副主席。
description.en: One of the leaders of the Communist Party of China and the People's Republic of China, one of the Eight Elders of the CPC, who served as Vice President of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党、中国人民解放军和中华人民共和国的主要缔造者和领导人。
description.en: The main founder and leader of the Communist Party of China, the People's Liberation Army, and the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中国人民解放军大将，曾任中共中央军委秘书长。
description.en: A general of the People's Liberation Army, who served as Secretary-General of the CPC Central Military Commission.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国政治家、外交家、军事家，曾任中共中央军委秘书长。
description.en: A politician, diplomat, and military strategist of the People's Republic of China, who served as Secretary-General of the CPC Central Military Commission.

description.zh-cn: 杨尚昆的胞弟，解放军上将，曾任中共中央军委秘书长兼总政治部主任。
description.en: Younger brother of Yang Shangkun, a general of the PLA, who served as Secretary-General of the CPC Central Military Commission and Director of the General Political Department.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党和中华人民共和国的领导人之一，曾任中共中央办公厅主任。
description.en: One of the leaders of the Communist Party of China and the People's Republic of China, who served as Director of the General Office of the CPC Central Committee.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党和中华人民共和国的领导人之一，曾任中共中央办公厅主任。
description.en: One of the leaders of the Communist Party of China and the People's Republic of China, who served as Director of the General Office of the CPC Central Committee.

description.zh-cn: 杨尚昆的妻子，参加了二万五千里长征的女红军，曾任中央戏剧学院党委书记、副院长。
description.en: Wife of Yang Shangkun, a female Red Army soldier who participated in the Long March. She served as Party Secretary and Vice President of the Central Academy of Drama.

description.zh-cn: 杨尚昆长子，原国防科工委某研究所所长。
description.en: Eldest son of Yang Shangkun, former director of an institute under the Commission for Science, Technology and Industry for National Defense.

description.zh-cn: 杨尚昆次子，摄影家，现任中国宋庆龄基金会副主席。
description.en: Second son of Yang Shangkun, a photographer, currently serving as Vice Chairman of the China Soong Ching Ling Foundation.

description.zh-cn: 杨尚昆之女，曾为总参谋部少将。
description.en: Daughter of Yang Shangkun, former major general of the General Staff Department.

description.zh-cn: 杨尚昆四哥，中国共产党党员，著名烈士。
description.en: Fourth older brother of Yang Shangkun, a member of the Communist Party of China and a famous martyr.

description.zh-cn: 20世纪20年代在苏联莫斯科创办的一所大学，旨在为中国革命培养人才。
description.en: A university founded in Moscow, Soviet Union in the 1920s, aimed at training personnel for the Chinese revolution.

en: President of the People's Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的国家元首职位。
description.en: The head of state of the People's Republic of China.

nodes.id: 中华人民共和国中央军事委员会

zh-cn: 中华人民共和国中央军事委员会
en: Central Military Commission of the People's Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国最高的国家军事领导机关，领导全国武装力量。
description.en: The supreme national military leadership body of the People's Republic of China, leading the country's armed forces.

nodes.id: 中国共产党中央军事委员会

zh-cn: 中国共产党中央军事委员会
en: Central Military Commission of the Communist Party of China

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党领导的最高军事指挥机构。
description.en: The supreme military command body led by the Communist Party of China.

zh-cn: 中国共产党中央委员会办公厅

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党中央委员会的办事机构，负责处理中央日常文书、机要、会务、警卫等工作。
description.en: The administrative body of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, responsible for handling daily documents, confidential matters, meetings, security, etc.

description.zh-cn: 1989年发生在中国的一系列学生和民众示威活动，最终以武力清场告终。
description.en: A series of student and popular demonstrations in China in 1989, which ended with a military crackdown.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党和中华人民共和国前主要领导人，曾任中华人民共和国国务院总理。在六四事件中采取强硬立场。
description.en: A former major leader of the Communist Party of China and the People's Republic of China, who served as Premier of the State Council. He took a hardline stance during the 1989 Tiananmen Square protests.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党和中华人民共和国前主要领导人，曾任中共中央总书记。因在六四事件中对学生表示同情而被罢免。
description.en: A former major leader of the Communist Party of China and the People's Republic of China, who served as General Secretary of the CPC Central Committee. He was purged for his sympathetic stance towards students during the 1989 Tiananmen Square protests.

description.zh-cn: 1992年邓小平视察中国南方，发表了一系列重要讲话，对推动中国经济改革与发展产生了深远影响。
description.en: Deng Xiaoping's inspection tour of Southern China in 1992, during which he delivered a series of important speeches that had a profound impact on promoting China's economic reform and development.

description.zh-cn: 中国自1978年开始实施的一系列经济改革和社会开放政策。
description.en: A series of economic reform and social opening policies implemented in China since 1978.

description.zh-cn: 1966年至1976年在中国发生的一场政治运动，对中国社会造成了巨大动荡和破坏。
description.en: A political movement in China from 1966 to 1976 that caused immense social turmoil and destruction.

description.zh-cn: 文化大革命前夕发生的政治事件，彭真、罗瑞卿、陆定一、杨尚昆被打成“反党集团”。
description.en: A political event on the eve of the Cultural Revolution, in which Peng Zhen, Luo Ruiqing, Lu Dingyi, and Yang Shangkun were labeled an 'anti-Party clique'.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党和中华人民共和国的领导人之一，中共八大元老之一，在“彭、罗、陆、杨反党集团案”中首当其冲。
description.en: One of the leaders of the Communist Party of China and the People's Republic of China, one of the Eight Elders of the CPC, who was the primary target in the 'Peng, Luo, Lu, Yang Anti-Party Clique' case.

description.zh-cn: 中国人民解放军大将，“彭、罗、陆、杨反党集团案”成员之一。
description.en: A general of the People's Liberation Army, one of the members of the 'Peng, Luo, Lu, Yang Anti-Party Clique' case.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党和中华人民共和国的领导人之一，“彭、罗、陆、杨反党集团案”成员之一。
description.en: One of the leaders of the Communist Party of China and the People's Republic of China, one of the members of the 'Peng, Luo, Lu, Yang Anti-Party Clique' case.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党和中华人民共和国前主要领导人，曾任中华人民共和国主席，在文化大革命中被迫害致死。
description.en: A former major leader of the Communist Party of China and the People's Republic of China, who served as President of the PRC and was persecuted to death during the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国时期的一所大学，被誉为“文有上大，武有黄埔”。
description.en: A university during the Republic of China era, known as 'Shanghai University for civil affairs, Whampoa for military affairs'.

description.zh-cn: 中国人民解放军的创建人和领导人之一，中华人民共和国元帅。
description.en: One of the founders and leaders of the People's Liberation Army, a Marshal of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中国工农红军主力部队之一。
description.en: One of the main forces of the Chinese Workers' and Peasants' Red Army.

description.zh-cn: 中国工农红军的一次大规模军事转移和战略撤退。
description.en: A large-scale military transfer and strategic retreat of the Chinese Workers' and Peasants' Red Army.

description.zh-cn: 指中共十四大前，杨尚昆、杨白冰兄弟被指意图夺取军权，最终被邓小平解除军权的政治事件。
description.en: Refers to the political incident before the 14th National Congress of the CPC, where brothers Yang Shangkun and Yang Baibing were accused of attempting to seize military power, ultimately leading to their removal from military authority by Deng Xiaoping.

description.zh-cn: 杨尚昆与李伯钊于1929年在苏联莫斯科结婚。
description.en: Yang Shangkun married Li Bozhao in Moscow, Soviet Union in 1929.

description.zh-cn: 杨绍京是杨尚昆的长子。
description.en: Yang Shaojing is the eldest son of Yang Shangkun.

description.zh-cn: 杨绍明是杨尚昆的次子。
description.en: Yang Shaoming is the second son of Yang Shangkun.

description.zh-cn: 杨李是杨尚昆的女儿。
description.en: Yang Li is the daughter of Yang Shangkun.

description.zh-cn: 杨白冰是杨尚昆的胞弟。
description.en: Yang Baibing is the younger brother of Yang Shangkun.

description.zh-cn: 杨暗公是杨尚昆的四哥。
description.en: Yang Angong is the fourth older brother of Yang Shangkun.

description.zh-cn: 1926年11月，杨尚昆受中共委派赴苏联，入莫斯科中山大学学习。
description.en: In November 1926, Yang Shangkun was sent by the CPC to the Soviet Union to study at Moscow Sun Yat-sen University.

description.zh-cn: 1926年，杨尚昆入上海大学学习。
description.en: In 1926, Yang Shangkun enrolled in Shanghai University to study.

description.zh-cn: 杨尚昆接替李先念担任中华人民共和国第四任主席。
description.en: Yang Shangkun succeeded Li Xiannian as the fourth President of the People's Republic of China.

position.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国副主席
position.en: Vice President of the People's Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 在杨尚昆担任国家主席期间，王震担任副主席。
description.en: During Yang Shangkun's presidency, Wang Zhen served as Vice President.

relationships.target: 中华人民共和国中央军事委员会

description.zh-cn: 杨尚昆担任中华人民共和国中央军事委员会副主席。
description.en: Yang Shangkun served as Vice Chairman of the Central Military Commission of the People's Republic of China.

relationships.target: 中国共产党中央军事委员会

description.zh-cn: 杨尚昆担任中国共产党中央军事委员会副主席。
description.en: Yang Shangkun served as Vice Chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Communist Party of China.

position.zh-cn: 中共中央军委副主席、秘书长
position.en: Vice Chairman and Secretary-General of the CPC Central Military Commission

description.zh-cn: 在邓小平担任中央军委主席期间，杨尚昆担任副主席及秘书长。
description.en: While Deng Xiaoping was Chairman of the Central Military Commission, Yang Shangkun served as Vice Chairman and Secretary-General.

position.en: Vice Chairman of the CPC Central Military Commission

description.zh-cn: 在江泽民接任中央军委主席后，杨尚昆继续担任副主席。
description.en: After Jiang Zemin took over as Chairman of the Central Military Commission, Yang Shangkun continued to serve as Vice Chairman.

description.zh-cn: 杨尚昆长期担任中共中央办公厅主任。
description.en: Yang Shangkun served as the Director of the General Office of the CPC Central Committee for a long period.

position.zh-cn: 中共中央军委秘书长、中共中央办公厅主任
position.en: Secretary-General of the CPC Central Military Commission, Director of the General Office of the CPC Central Committee

description.zh-cn: 在毛泽东担任党主席和军委主席期间，杨尚昆担任中央办公厅主任和军委秘书长。
description.en: While Mao Zedong was Chairman of the Party and the Military Commission, Yang Shangkun served as Director of the General Office and Secretary-General of the Military Commission.

description.zh-cn: 长征期间，杨尚昆和彭德怀率领红三军团，杨尚昆任政治委员。
description.en: During the Long March, Yang Shangkun and Peng Dehuai led the Third Red Army Corps, with Yang serving as its Political Commissar.

description.zh-cn: 长征期间，杨尚昆与彭德怀共同率领红三军团。
description.en: During the Long March, Yang Shangkun and Peng Dehuai jointly led the Third Red Army Corps.

description.zh-cn: 文化大革命开始后，杨尚昆被列为“彭、罗、陆、杨反党集团”成员，被撤销一切职务并受到监护审查。
description.en: After the start of the Cultural Revolution, Yang Shangkun was labeled a member of the 'Peng, Luo, Lu, Yang Anti-Party Clique', stripped of all positions, and placed under surveillance and investigation.

description.zh-cn: 刘少奇在一次座谈会上发表讲话，将彭、罗、陆、杨定性为反对毛主席、企图实现修正主义政策的反党集团。
description.en: In a speech at a symposium, Liu Shaoqi characterized Peng, Luo, Lu, and Yang as an anti-Party clique opposing Chairman Mao and attempting to implement revisionist policies.

description.zh-cn: 在六四天安门事件期间，杨尚昆最终表明坚决支持李鹏、邓小平的决定，支持对事件的武力镇压。
description.en: During the 1989 Tiananmen Square incident, Yang Shangkun ultimately expressed firm support for the decisions of Li Peng and Deng Xiaoping, endorsing the military crackdown.

description.zh-cn: 1992年春，杨尚昆陪同邓小平进行南方巡视，并和其弟杨白冰公开表态军方坚定支持改革开放。
description.en: In the spring of 1992, Yang Shangkun accompanied Deng Xiaoping on his Southern Tour, and together with his brother Yang Baibing, publicly declared the military's firm support for the reform and opening-up policy.

description.zh-cn: 杨家将事件后，杨尚昆在中共十四大后卸任所有党内和军内重要职务，并于次年卸任国家主席后退休。
description.en: After the 'Yang Family Generals' incident, Yang Shangkun stepped down from all important Party and military positions after the 14th CPC National Congress, and retired after stepping down as President the following year.
